Description: Rim fragment with turn to body of Milesian pottery Ionian cup; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed below; exterior: top of rim glazed, rest reserved; top of handle zone glazed. Graffito on exterior.
Curator's comments: When transferred to the BM from the EES the fragment was wrongly identified as coming from the Osireion at Abydos. There can be no doubt, however, about its actual findspot, since the inscription clearly identifies it as no. 116 in Edgar's list of the inscribed pottery fragments from Naukratis.
Bibliographic references: Edgar 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis. B: The Inscribed and Painted Pottery (no. 116)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 705, no. 639)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.864)
